title: Should my boyfriend & i Get married even tho he has a lot of debt will collectors come after me 4 his debt?or file 4 bankruptcy?
question: I am a 24 year old woman, he is a 24 year old man, he needs medical coverage and my work will cover him only if we are married. Problem is he is buried in about 10,000 of debt with collectors coming after him, he wants to filebankruptcy soon, but in the mean time he needs medical coverage. Should we get married to get coverage? or should he file bankruptcy first? will collectors coming after me for his preexisting debt? can i buy a house if we are married, & he files bankruptcy
answers:
I agree with the answer above.

There are many issued not considered in your question but are very important.
How much do you both make. If you are making too much together, your soon to be husband will not be able to file chapter 7 liquidation.
To start off with a new slate, file the bankruptcy first, than get married the next day. Assuming you both make less the the limit when considered together, marrying your boyfriend will not cause you to be liable for his debts but don't put your assets together until after bankruptcy. If you can buy a house without your prospective husband's income, buy the house before the marriage. It will be harder in this market to get low interest with husband seek loan after bankruptcy.

Agreed.

Also, ask yourself this - how can you afford to purchase a home if $10K in old debt is too much of a burden to overcome? Please be honest with yourself and with your fiance - it will make sure you are not in this position again.

Good luck.
